content: vs it is absolutely crucial you do not forget the ch2 at the start and double_crochet into last st at the end of every even-numbered row so that you have a place to put your first and last vs in the odd-numbered row otherwise your shawl will look funky rather than having a nice top edge note i know it might seem a little crazy that the even-numbered row are started with a ch2 instead of a ch3 or even ch4 at the start especially since they end with ch1 double_crochet trust me i tried it with ch3 and when i held up the beginnings of my shawl the sides weren t even this is a top-down shawl… it shouldn t be asymmetrical only by changing it to ch2 at the start of the row did it come out even if you don t mind a bit of asymmetry and a ch3 makes it easier for you to put that last v of your odd-numbered row go for it personally it bothered me and i had to change it also i chain loosely so if you chain tightly ch3 might work just fine all that remains is a crudely-drawn chart
